availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Littlejohn (Grayson, Carter County, Kentucky, laborer and soldier)

body.p: Grayson, Kentucky, laborer and soldier. Greenup County, Kentucky, native. Son of John Littlejohn and Mahala Plummer Littlejohn. Married Elizabeth J. Davis Littlejohn in Carter County on December 9, 1856. Father of Julia M. Littlejohn and Marissa B. Littlejohn. Laborer in Bath County, Kentucky in 1850. Served in the 40th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a first lieutenant and quarter-master from September 28, 1863 to December 30, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Division 2, p. 38B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, Precinct 5, p. 124B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994027-58, Carter County Marriages, p. 5 of 22 on microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 425, 432.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 398.
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1964), KDLA, Roll #7016203: All Counties, Carter County Deaths, File #3530.
Find A Grave, "George W. Littlejohn (1833-1918)," Memorial #89105607, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/89105607 (accessed January 13, 2020).
